 How to get started using SDL_Config

 Sample of configurartion files syntax
 SDL_Config automated test defines
 SDL_Config public API
 Structures in this file are for internal use of library only
T
 Technical stuff
In order to change behaviour of SDL_Config, you must make changes directly in SDL config cfg.h file, then recompile SDL_Config, and finally recompile your application.
If you don’t have the time or the will to read everything at Syntax page, I recommend you to look at least at the following example, so you will get the feel of what is and isn’t legal to do in the current version of SDL_Config.
They don’t form part of SDL_Config API, but are used by test programs to automatically determine whether SDL_Config contains bugs in tested functions.
This is documentation of internal SDL_Config structures, and as such, it’s not for normal library user.
If you’re programmer who likes to have complete control over his programs, you may wonder what lies within SDL_Config.
